description: From Middle English parcimonie, from Middle French parsimonie, from Latin parsimōnia (“frugality, sparingness”), from pars-, past participle stem of parcere (“to spare”), + -monia, suffix signifying action, state, or condition.

entries.meaning: Great reluctance to spend money unnecessarily.
examples: Synonyms: stinginess, frugality, economy; see also Thesaurus:stingy, Thesaurus:frugal

entries.meaning: (by extension) The quality or characteristic of using the fewest resources or explanations to solve a problem.
